result.execSummary:
The defendant Cody James Akey was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Penalties for Misdemeanors-Class "B"], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Inclusive of costs.
Apply bond on file.

Defendant to provide a DNA sample.
Bond continies until reports to jail to provide sample.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Cody James Akey

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: c: Def, Atty, DA & SSPD. eif
signed by Def & Atty this date. eif

CO: RMW, REP: Drost, CLERK: Liddle. ADA:  Alexis S. Mckinley   DF ATTY:  Joel Kenneth Larimore   DF:  Cody James Akey appeared. Case called at 3:48 p.m. ADA McKinley states there is an agreement and recites recommendations. Atty Larimore in agreement.   Court reads charge and maximum penalty. DE pleads NO CONTEST to Ct 1 in 15CM451 . DE sworn. Crt reviews plea questionnaire and informs DE of rights. Crt finds DE freely, voluntarily and knowingly waives rights and makes plea. Attorney's stipulate to the facts. Crt accepts plea, finds factual basis and finds DE guilty of Ct 1 in 15CM451. Bond will continue until defendant reports to jail to provide DNA Sample. Crt orders:

- $500.00 fine inclusive of costs. $250.00 bond on file to apply. 

- Provide DNA Sample

CO: RMW, REP: Drost, CLERK: Liddle. ADA:  Alexis S. Mckinley   DF ATTY:  Joel Kenneth Larimore   DF:  Cody James Akey appeared via phone. Case called at 2:46 p.m.  Defendant retained counsel. Court informs def of charges, possible penalties and rights. Def understands.  Waives reading.  NG.  Defendant to appear in person. Address confirmed. Bond continues.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for October 12, 2015 at 03:45 pm.
from Atty. Larimore re: requesting DE to appear by phone. Per RMW on 08-25-2015, phone appearance approved. gme

Absolute sobriety:  Zero alcohol, zero controlled substances, zero prescribed medications (except as taken and prescribed for you by a physician) in your system, on your person, or in your possession at all times while this case is ongoing. This prohibition includes drug paraphernalia.

  It is hereby ordered, as a condition of the defendant's bond/bail in the above-captioned case, that he/she have absolutely NO CONTACT whatsoever with the complaining witness, or with any of the following named persons and/or locations, Lookout Bar and Float Rite Park.  The term "no contact" is hereby defined as no contact in person, by telephone, by way of electronic device, email, facsimile, social media including but not limited to texting, Facebook, Twitter, contact through the mail, and/or through a third person.  The aforementioned condition of bond/bail is set pursuant to Sec. 969.02(3)(d), Wis Stats.

Further, it is ORDERED that if the defendant fails to comply with the conditions of his/her bond/bail that he/she may be charged with the offense of bailjumping contrary to Sec. 946.49(1)(a), Wis. Stats.

CO: RMW, REP: Drost, CLERK: Minot. ADA:  Alexis S. Mckinley. Cody James Akey pro se. Case called at 1:58 pm.   Defendant advised of the right to Attorney. Defendant would like to hire an Attorney. km  Initial appearance scheduled for August 28, 2015 at 02:45 pm.
